SCHD.SPREAD

Specifies the new spread to be used for calculating penalty spread from the date input in the SCHD.DATE.FREQ field. This field may only be input if the corresponding SCHD.TYPE is "SC". This field is part of an associated multivalue set.

1-11 numeric type R characters including optional decimal point. (Associated mutlivalue field). Input only allowed if corresponding SCHD.TYPE is "SC". Input must be greater than 0. Input cannot be greater than 100. If the field MINIMUM.RATE is defined on the PD.PARAMETER record then the input cannot be less than this value. If the field MAXIMUM.LEGAL.RATE is defined on the PD.PARAMETER record then the input may not be greater than this value.
SCHD.TYPE

Defines the type of scheduled event to take place. Input to this field is only allowed for the SCHEDULE operation. The types of schedule which may be currently input are for rate or spread changes and for producing chaser advices. This field is part of an associated multivalue set.

2-8 alphanumeric type A characters. (Associated multivalue field). Must be a valid entry on the PD.SCHEDULE.TYPE file. Input only allowed for SCHEDULE operation. "RC" (rate change) schedule not allowed if the contents of field STATUS is "NAB". "SC" (spread change) schedule not allowed if the contents of field STATUS is "NAB".
START.DATE
The date on which the PD record is created.
STATUS

Signifies the overall status of the PD contract. This field is automatically updated by the system. It shows the "worst" status of the contract, e.g. if we have two payments due and the statuses of the two in the field REPAID.STATUS are "NAB" and "PDO", then the status in this field would be "NAB". The possible values in this field are: GRA - grace (penalty interest not being calculated or posted) PDO - past due obligation (penalty interest being calculated and posted) NAB - non accrual basis (penalty interest being calculated but not posted) CUR - current (not currently overdue but was previously), WOF (written off), FWOF (financial write-off) and MAT - matured (nothing due and underlying loan is fully repaid).
3 alphabetical characters which must be one of the above statuses. Noinput field.
STMT.NO

A number generated automatically by the system which identifies either a statement entry or a category entry in respect of the PD contract. Whenever an amendment to, or input of, a contract requires an accounting entry to be raised, this field will record the IDs of the entries generated. The IDs to accounting entries, both STMT.ENTRYs and CATEG.ENTRYs, consist of a date-time stamp and a sequence number. All entries raised by a particular input/transaction will have the same date-time stamp but different sequence numbers. This field has three multivalues, the first contains the base date-time stamp which is common to all entries. The second contains the sequence numbers of the STMT.ENTRYs raised and the third the sequence numbers of any CATEG.ENTRYs. Whenever a contract is viewed using the (S)ee function this field will show the entry IDs that were raised by that version of the contract only. If the amendment made on a particular version did not raise any entries, then the field will be blank. Any end of day processing which raises accounting entries will also update this field and write a history record. This is a multivalue field.
Up to 29 alphanumeric characters. (Multivalue field). Noinput field.
TOT.AFTER.DEDUCT

Specifies the total amount which is actually used towards repayment of the funds due. This amount may not be the same as the TOT.REPAY.AMT due to the deduction of any charges or taxes on the amounts due. This is equivalent to the TOT.REPAY.AMT minus the total of any charges and taxes.
Up to 19 numeric type AMT characters. Noinput field.
TOT.OD.TYPE.AMT

Identifies the total amount due for the particular type defined in the associated field TOT.OVRDUE.TYPE. This field is the sum of the subvalue fields PAY.AMT.OUTS for the type defined in the associated field TOT.OVRDUE.TYPE.
Up to 19 numeric type AMT characters. (Associated multivalue field). Noinput field.
TOT.OVRDUE.TYPE
Specifies the type of payment which is overdue. This field is a multivalue field associated with TOT.OD.TYPE.AMT.
2-12 alphanumeric type A characters. (Associated multivalue field). Must be a valid entry on the PD.AMOUNT.TYPE file. Noinput field.
TOT.REPAY.AMT
Specifies the amount being repaid by the customer. This amount is the amount presented by the customer to the bank in respect of the payment due.
Up to 19 numeric type AMT characters. Input must be greater than 0. The amount being repaid cannot be greater than what is owed.
TOTAL.AMT.TO.REPAY

Identifies the total amount that is overdue for the PD contract. This amount is the sum of all outstandings due by type such as principal, interest, charges etc. as well as any taxes due. Basically it is the sum of the fields TOTAL.OVERDUE.AMT and TOTAL.OVERDUE.TAX.
Up to 19 numeric type AMT characters. Noinput field.
CHARGE.AMT

Specifies the amount of charge to be taken on the repayment. This amount will be automatically be calculated if the corresponding charge code is present in the field CHARGE.TYPE based on the repayment amount. It is possible to override this calculated value with one of the user's choice. This charge will be taken in the currency of the PD contract. This field is part of an associated multivalue set.
1-19 numeric type AMT characters - Optional input. (Associated multivalue field). Input mandatory if corresponding field CHARGE.TYPE present.
TOTAL.OVERDUE.AMT
Identifies the total amount due for the individual payment types on the PD contract. This field is the sum of the multivalue fields TOT.OD.TYPE.AMT.
Up to 19 numeric type AMT characters. Noinput field.
TOTAL.OVERDUE.TAX
Identifies the total amount of tax outstanding on the PD contract. This field is the sum of the multivalue fields PAYMENT.AMT.TAX.
Up to 19 numeric type AMT characters. Noinput field.
WOF.REASON
This field is used to capture the reasons for write-off (during manual WRITE-OFF).
Maximum of 2 Numeric characters. Optional input. Should be a valid key to PD.WOF.REASON table.
CHARGE.TAX.AMT

Specifies the amount of tax levied on the charge taken on the repayment. This field is generated automatically by the system. This amount is held in the currency of the PD contract. This field is part of an associated multivalue set.
Up to 19 numeric type AMT characters. (Associated multivalue field). Noinput field.
CHARGE.TAX.CODE

Specifies the tax code to be used to levy any tax on the amount being charged on the repayment. This field is automatically updated by the system if the corresponding charge code has the field TAX.CODE furnished on either the FT.CHARGE.TYPE or FT.COMMISSION.TYPE file. This field is part of an associated multivalue set.
Up to 2 numeric characters. (Associated multivalue field). This field is system generated. Noinput field.
CHARGE.TAX.LCY

Specifies the amount of tax, in the local currency, levied on the charge taken on the repayment. This field is automatically generated by the system. This field is part of an associated multivalue set.
Up to 19 numeric type AMT characters. (Associated multivalue field). Noinput field.
CHARGE.TAX.XRTE

Specifies the exchange rate used in the conversion of the tax amount to it's local currency equivalent. This field is automatically generated by the system, though only if the currency of the PD contract is different to the local currency. This field is part of an associated multivalue set.
Up to 11 numeric characters plus a decimal point. (Associated multivalue field). Noinput field.
CHARGE.TYPE

Defines the type of charge which is to be taken on the amount being repaid by the customer. The charge must be an existing entry on the FT.CHARGE.TYPE table or on the FT.COMMISSION.TYPE TABLE. If any codes are input on the PD.PARAMETER record in field DEFAULT.CHARGES then these code/s will be defaulted into this field, though it is possible to override these defaults by deleting them. This field is part of an associated multivalue set.

1-11 alphanumeric type CHG characters - Optional input. (Associated multivalue field). Input mandatory if corresponding field CHARGE.AMT present. Must be a valid entry on either the FT.CHARGE.TYPE table or on the FT.COMMISSION.TYPE table.
CONSOL.KEY

Identifies the ID of the consolidation record on the CONSOLIDATE.ASST.LIAB file into which this contract is to be consolidated for financial reporting. This field is maintained by the system during the end of day batch processing. It is defaulted from the underlying loan, the only change being that the first two characters, which are the IDs to the application such as "LD" or "MM" are replaced by "PD".
Up to 70 alphanumeric characters. Noinput field.
CONTRACT.GRP
The group to which this contract / customer belongs based on the rules defined in the PD.PAYMENT.DUE record of APPL.GEN.CONDITION
No input field; system updated
CONTRACT.NUMBER

A unique reference number which identifies a particular Payment Due contract. Contract numbers are generated automatically by the system and are composed of the underlying deal's contract number with a prefix of "PD", e.g. PDMM9601200015. From this example we can see that the PD record was created through the Money Market application for the deal MM9601200015. Input of new PD transactions is not allowed as they can only be created by the system. It is possible to create a Payment Due contract without an underlying loan contract being present using the PD.CAPTURE application. If this is the case then the Id to the file will be in the format PDPDYYDDDNNNNN, e.g. PDPD9708900023.

10 numeric characters prefixed by "PDXX", where XX is the application for which the PD record has been raised, e.g. LD, MM or MG. XX may be PD if the Payment Due contract was produced through the PD.CAPTURE application without an underlying loan contract being present. If the reference number is entered, during initial input, it will be validated for uniqueness. The transaction number can never be changed. The ID to the contract from the third character onwards, in other words after the PD prefix, must exist on the live file of the underlying application. For example if we have a PD contract with an ID of PDMG9602300152, then a contract with an ID of MG9602300152 must exist on the MG.MORTGAGE file. The above is only not true if the PD contract was created through the PD.CAPTURE application without the presence of an underlying loan contract. Mandatory input.
CS.LAST.CAP.DATE
Holds the last spread capitalisation date
ACCOUNT.OFFICER

Identifies the Account Officer or Department responsible for the relationship with the counterparty. This field is automatically defaulted from the underlying contract when the PD contract is created. It is used by the Management Information System (M.I.S.) for the determination of the Customer Profitability Analysis.
1-4 digit numeric character. Must be a valid code on the DEPT.ACCT.OFFICER table. Noinput field.
CURRENCY
Indicates the Currency of the PD contract. This field is automatically defaulted from the underlying contract when the PD contract is created.
3 type SSS characters (uppercase alpha) or, 1 to 3 numeric Character currency code. Must be a valid Currency code on the CURRENCY table. Noinput field.
CURRENCY.MARKET

Identifies which Currency Market is accessed for this transaction. This field is automatically defaulted from the underlying contract when the PD contract is created. The use of this field will only be applicable for those countries where the exchange authorities have defined different markets for foreign currency dealing. A typical example would be Belgium where foreign currencies are dealt with on the Regular Market and also on the Free Market. The default value of "1" means that, for the majority of countries, where only one exchange rate market exists, input in this field will not be necessary. Note: In the present release, only one market can be defined on the CURRENCY.MARKET table. Consequently, for the time being, only the value of "1" will be accepted in this field.
One numeric digit Currency Market code. (System default value is "1") Must be a valid code on the CURRENCY.MARKET table. Noinput field.
CUSTOMER
Identifies the Customer of the PD contract. This field is automatically defaulted from the underlying contract when the PD contract is created.
3-10 alphanumeric customer mnemonic or, 1-10 numeric character customer number. Must be a valid Customer number or mnemonic on the CUSTOMER table. Noinput field.
CUSTOMER.NAME
Internal descriptor field
DEALER.DESK

Identifies the Dealer Desk relating to the PD transaction. For Money Market linked PDs this field is automatically defaulted from the underlying contract when the PD contract is created, but for the other application linked PDs this field is set to "00" upon creation. This code is used to maintain position at the dealer desk level.
2 alphanumeric character dealer code in the range "A-Z", "a-z", plus "0-9". Must be a valid entry on the DEALER.DESK table. Noinput field.
DELIVERY.REF

Identifies the ID of the delivery reference. The Delivery system acknowledges receipt by returning the ID of the Delivery reference that has been generated for the message. The ID takes the following form : D19960103-392226 where "D" signifies a delivered message (as opposed to "R" for a message received), "1996" the year, "01" the month, "03" the day in the month, and the code "392226" is the number of hundreds of seconds since midnight on that day. This field is part of an associated multivalue set.
17 alphanumeric characters. (Associated multivalue field). Must be a valid entry on the DE.O.HEADER file. Noinput field.
FINAL.DUE.DATE
Specifies the date on which the underlying loan matures. If the underlying loan is a call or notice type contract then this field will be empty, otherwise it is automatically defaulted.
11 type D characters - standard date format. Noinput field.
INTEREST.BASIS

Defines the Interest Day Basis which indicates the calculation method to be used for interest amount calculations. This field is automatically defaulted from the underlying contract when the PD contract is created. Can contain one of the following types, dependent on the underlying deal: Key Days/Denominator A 360/360 A1 360/360* A2 360/360* B 366/360 C 366/366 D 360/366 E 366/365 F 360/365 F1 360/365* F2 360/365* S Special For illustrations of all supported INTEREST.BASIS INTEREST.BASIS
1-2 alphanumeric characters. Must be a valid entry on the INTEREST.BASIS table. Noinput field.
LIMIT.AMOUNT
Identifies the total amount of outstanding principal on the PD contract held in the LIMITS system. This field is automatically defaulted.
Up to 19 numeric type AMT characters including negative "-" sign. Noinput field.
LIMIT.REFERENCE

Identifies the Limit Reference number of the PD contract. This field is automatically defaulted upon the creation of the PD contract though it may be changed by the User with the MAINTENANCE operation. An override will be given if the input differs from the default.
3-10 numeric characters Must be a valid
ADJUSTED.AMT

Identifies the actual amount which has been adjusted from the amount due in the corresponding field PAY.AMT.ORIG. This field is automatically updated if the ADJUSTMENT operation impacts this particular payment due. This field is part of an associated subvalue set.
Up to 19 numeric type AMT characters. (Associated subvalue field). Noinput field.
LIQUIDATION.MODE

This field identifies the manner in which overdue payments are handled. There are three options available: AUTOMATIC , SEMI-AUTOMATIC and MANUALAUTOMATIC will liquidate across the settlement accounts on the contract. DEFAULT valueMANUAL will create a PD contract instead.SEMI-AUTOMATIC will only raise a PD contract if insufficient funds exist on the settlement account.
LOAN.SPREAD
Spread from the underlying loan contract is stored in this field - for information only.
System updated field. User input not allowed.
LOCAL.REF
Identifies any local reference field(s) defined by the user. Identifies any additional element which has been defined locally to meet a particular requirement. This is a multivalue field.
Up to 35 characters as defined in the local table definition for this local reference field. (Multivalue field). Optional or mandatory input according to the LOCAL.TABLE definition for this field.
MANUAL.NAB

This field is to identify whether the pd has been maintained to nab by the the NAB.PERIOD.INT Once the user maintains a f ield populated as YES so that this contact does not get selected for the status.change functionality. The user can make this field NULL, as long as the contract is in nab so that the status change functionality will take effect.
System updated field. Updated value will be 'YES'. Can be made null by the user only if the contract is in 'NAB' using MAINTENANCE operation.
MESSAGE.DATE
Identifies the date that the associated Delivery message was produced. This field is part of an associated multivalue set.
11 type D characters - standard date format. (Associated multivalue field). Noinput field.
MESSAGE.TYPE

Confirms that the contract details have been passed over to the Delivery system for onward communication to the counterparty. This field is defaulted to the Delivery message ID (DE.MESSAGE) of the message sent to the Delivery system. This field is part of an associated multivalue set.
Up to 4 numeric characters. (Associated multivalue field). Noinput field.
MOVE.TO.HIS
Indicates if FWOF contracts will be moved to history or not
Holds YES, ''. PD will move to history only if 'YES'
NET.CUST.ENTRIES
Defines whether or not to net any accounting entries across the customer's account together. Note that CRF entries cannot be netted together.
1-2 alphabetic characters - "NO" or "YES". The system will default to "NO".
NEW.OUTS.AMT

Identifies the amount which is to be the new outstanding amount in the corresponding PAY.AMT.OUTS field. This field is used for the ADJUSTMENT operation. This field is part of an associated subvalue set.

Up to 19 numeric type AMT characters. (Associated subvalue field). Input only allowed with ADJUSTMENT operation. Input cannot be the same as the corresponding PAY.AMT.OUTS field. Input cannot be greater than the value in the corresponding PAY.AMT.ORIG field.
NOTES
Details any notes made by the user for informational purposes. This is a multivalue field.
Up to 35 alphanumeric type ANY characters. (Multivalue field). A maximum of four lines are allowed.
ADVICE.CHGS
This field specifies whether charges linked to advices will be applied to this contract. This field is used to override the setting of a charge on the PD.ADVICES record
Input can only be YES or NO (Optional input) Default (Blank) is YES.
OPERATION

Defines the processing to be performed on the PD contract. Only one type of process may be performed at one time of which there are four. They are MAINTENANCE, ADJUSTMENT, REPAYMENT and SCHEDULE. Upon input to a PD contract this is the only field which allows any input. Once an operation to be performed has been input this field blocks any further input and opens up the required fields depending upon the operation. Therefore to perform another operation on the same contract, the record must be authorised or deleted, unless of course one exits using F1. The MAINTENANCE operation is used to change contract details such as the limit reference of the PD contract, the status of individual payments due on a particular date, whether or not to net any entries across the customer's account together, or to change the customer's portfolio. The ADJUSTMENT operation is used to adjust the outstanding payment amounts, by type, either upwards or downwards. The REPAYMENT operation is used to for entering details when a customer wishes to repay all or part of his/her loan. The SCHEDULE operation is used for entering scheduled events such as rate or spread changes and for the production of chaser advices.

Input must be one of the following: MAINTENANCE, ADJUSTMENT, REPAYMENT, SCHEDULE. It is not necessary to type in full the operation to be performed. If for example an adjustment is to be made, then an input of "A" will suffice. Mandatory input.
ORIG.LIMIT.REF
Identifies the Limit Reference number of the underlying contract. This field is automatically defaulted from the underlying contract when the PD contract is created.
3-10 numeric characters LIMIT.REFERENCE code. Must be a valid LIMIT.REFERENCE number. Noinput field.
ORIG.STLMNT.ACT

Indicates the Original Settlement account/s of the underlying loan. This field is automatically defaulted from the underlying contract when the PD contract is created and subsequently updated. It is a multivalue field which will record different settlement accounts if the underlying account uses different accounts for settling different kinds of payments, e.g. for principal and interest.

1-16 numeric characters relating to a Customer account or a Nostro account. (Multivalue field). Must be a valid entry on the ACCOUNT table. Must be of the same currency as defined in the CURRENCY field. Noinput field.
OUTSTANDING.AMT

Identifies the total outstanding amount of the underlying loan on the date defined in the field PAYMENT.DTE.DUE. This amount is inclusive of the amounts on the PD contract, though not any penalty interest/spread amounts or any taxes/charges incurred since the PD contract came into existence. This field is automatically populated when the PD contract is created or subsequently updated. This field is part of an associated multivalue set.
For contingent deals like MD , this amount inclusive of Charge, Tax, Commission and A1 balance type.
Up to 19 numeric type AMT characters. (Associated multivalue field). Noinput field.
OVERRIDE

Contains all the Override messages which the user agreed to during Input. During the validation of a contract, the system may provide the user with a series of screen override messages to indicate an anomaly, for instance, the repayment date is not a working day. In the event that the user confirms the Override, the full text of the actual Override Message will be stored, for reference purposes only, in this multivalue field. In the example given above when the deal is validated a warning bell will sound and a message will appear, at the foot of the screen, which reads: "REPAYMENT DATE IS NOT A WORKING DAY" This will draw the user's attention to the account entered, which may be a mistake and can then be corrected, alternatively the input may be correct in which case the user must confirm the input. If, subsequently, the contract record is either fully displayed or printed then all override messages raised during the input of that version of the contract will be displayed. This is a multivalue field.
Up to 35 alphanumeric type A characters. (Multivalue field). Noinput field.
PARAMETER.RECORD

Specifies which record on the PD.PARAMETER file this PD contract is currently using. This field is automatically updated when the PD contract is created and may subsequently change if relevant new records are added to the PD.PARAMETER file.
May only contain "SYSTEM" or, up to 5 numeric characters CATEGORY code. Must be a valid code on the CATEGORY table. Noinput field.
PAY.AMT.ORIG

Identifies the amount originally due for the corresponding payment type on the date defined in the field PAYMENT.DTE.DUE. This is the amount which was originally due and does not reflect any repayments or adjustments which may have been made. This field is automatically populated when the PD contract is created or subsequently updated. This field is part of an associated subvalue set.
Up to 19 numeric type AMT characters. (Associated subvalue field). Noinput field.
PAY.AMT.OSTX

Identifies the amount of tax due on the corresponding amount in the field PAY.AMT.OUTS. This field is automatically populated when the PD contract is created or subsequently updated. This field is part of an associated subvalue set.
Up to 19 numeric type AMT characters. (Associated subvalue field). Noinput field.
PAY.AMT.OUTS

Identifies the amount outstanding for the corresponding payment amount. Any repayments or adjustments are reflected in this amount if they impact this particular payment due. This field is automatically populated when the PD contract is created or subsequently updated. This field is part of an associated subvalue set.
Up to 19 numeric type AMT characters. (Associated subvalue field). Noinput field.
PAY.TYPE

Indicates the type of payment which is overdue on the date defined in field PAYMENT.DTE.DUE. This field is automatically populated when the PD contract is created or subsequently updated. This field is part of an associated subvalue set.
2-12 alphanumeric type A characters. (Associated subvalue field). Must be a valid entry on the PD.AMOUNT.TYPE file. Noinput field.
ADVICE.FREQ
System updated . Derived from the relevant PD.PARAMETER record.
No input field If STATUS.ADV.STOP is set to NO in the parameter record, then this field will not be populated.
PAYMENT.AMOUNT

Identifies the total outstanding amount due at the date defined in field PAYMENT.DTE.DUE for all the different payment types. This field is the sum of the subvalue fields PAY.AMT.OUTS. This field is automatically populated when the PD contract is created or subsequently updated. This field is part of an associated multivalue set.
Up to 19 numeric type AMT characters. (Associated multivalue field). Noinput field.
PAYMENT.AMT.TAX

Identifies the total amount of tax due on the date defined in the field PAYMENT.DTE.DUE for all the different payment types. This field is the sum of the subvalue fields PAY.AMT.OSTX. This field is automatically populated when the PD contract is created or subsequently updated. This field is part of an associated multivalue set.
Up to 19 numeric type AMT characters. (Associated multivalue field). Noinput field.
PAYMENT.DTE.DUE

Specifies the date on which the payment was due. This field is automatically populated when the PD contract is created or subsequently updated. This date is also used as part of the ID to the PD.BALANCES file. This field is part of an associated multivalue set.
11 type D characters - standard date format. (Associated multivalue field). Noinput field.
PENALTY.KEY

Contains the key to the BASIC.RATE.TEXT table, and subsequently the BASIC.INTEREST table, which indicates the interest rate to be applied for the calculation of penalty interest for floating rate type PD contracts. This field is automatically defaulted from the underlying contract or the PD.PARAMETER file, depending on how the parameter record is set up. Note: Either this field or PENALTY.RATE must contain a value, but not both.

1-4 numeric characters. (Optional input). Must be a valid entry on the BASIC.RATE.TEXT table. Cannot contain a value if PENALTY.RATE is not null. Must contain a value if PENALTY.RATE is null. Noinput field.
PENALTY.RATE

Defines the fixed interest rate at which penalty interest is calculated for the PD contract. This field is automatically defaulted from the underlying contract or the PD.PARAMETER file, depending on how the parameter record is set up. If the SCHEDULE operation is used to make a rate change, then the new rate will be updated in this field, and also be present on the PD.RATES file. Note: Either this field or PENALTY.KEY must contain a value, but not both.
1-11 numeric type R characters plus a decimal point. (Optional input). Cannot contain a value if PENALTY.KEY is not null. Must contain a value if PENALTY.KEY is null. Noinput field.
PENALTY.SPREAD

Indicates the rate at which penalty spread is calculated for the PD contract. If the PD.PARAMETER file has been set up to accrue penalty spread separately then this field will be automatically updated. If the SCHEDULE operation is used to make a spread change, then the new spread rate will not be reflected in this field, but will be present on the PD.RATES file. This field only contains the original value at the time of the PD's creation.
1-11 numeric type R characters plus a decimal point. (Optional input). Noinput field.
PORTFOLIO.NUMBER

Identifies the customer portfolio number to which the PD contract will be associated with. This will be used for the portfolio valuation for the customer. Noinput will result in the deal to be excluded from the portfolio valuation.
Up to 3 numeric characters. Input only allowed if the operation is MAINTENANCE. Any input will be validated against the SEC.ACC.MASTER application.
POSITION.TYPE

Identifies the Position Type applicable to the PD contract. This field is automatically defaulted from the underlying contract when the PD contract is created. This field is not used at present and is reserved for future use.
2 alphanumeric characters (System default value is "TR") Noinput field.
PREVENT.RETRY

With the opening up of EOD retry for all PDPD contracts apart from the PD contracts with the underlying contract's liquidation mode SEMI-AUTOMATIC, the functionality of this field has been enabled for the user to PREVENT the EOD RETRY for a particular PD contract. This field can now be input through a MAINTENANCE operation. The default value in this field (for no input by user) is NULL and the only value permitted for input is YES. During EOD retry, all PD records with value NULL in PREVENT.RETRY will only be selected (provided it is a PDPD contract or a contract with the liquidation mode of underlying contract being SEMI-AUTOMATIC). Should the user desire that a particular PD record should not be selected for such retry, using MAINTENANCE operation the value YES is to be input in this field.
Can be input by MAINTENANCE operation only. Only accepted value 'YES'. If no input done by user value held is 'NULL'.
PROVISION

Indicates the Provision percentage that has been applied for this contract. If the contract is eligible for Provisioning, system updates this field during COB according to the rules defined in ASSET.CLASS.PARAMETER. Allows Manual input as well (by changing PROVISION.METHOD field to MANUAL) to override the System classification. Accounting entries would be raised online in accordance with the new Provision percentage.

Field opens up for MAINTENANCE operation. Input allowed only when PROVISION.METHOD is MANUAL. Holds Null when there is no asset classification. Maximum of 3 Numeric characters. Allows '0'(Zero) value.
ASSET.CLASS

Indicates the asset classification for the contract. If the contract is eligible for Provisioning, system updates this field during COB according to the rules stated in ASSET.CLASS.PARAMETER. Allows Manual input as well (by changing PROVISION.METHOD field to MANUAL) to override the System classification. Accounting entries would be raised online in accordance with the new asset class.

Field opens up for MAINTENANCE operation. Input allowed only when PROVISION.METHOD is MANUAL Should be a valid key to LN.ASSET.CLASS table. Holds Null when there is no asset classification. Maximum of 3 Numeric characters.
PROVISION.AMOUNT
Indicates the total amount provisioned for this PD. System computes Provisioning on the total overdue PR amount.
No-Input field Standard Amount field.
PROVISION.METHOD

Indicates whether asset classification should be computed Automatically or maintained manually. When this field is populated with NULL (for new contracts) or AUTO, system computes the asset classification during the next Provision review Frequency( defined in ASSET.CLASS.PARAMETER) and updates the ASSET.CLASS, PROVISION and PROVISION.AMOUNT with the new details. When this field is populated as MANUAL, it is assumed that the user Manages the asset classification manually and the contract would be skipped for any computation of asset classification until the field is switched back to AUTO.
Accepts either MANUAL or AUTO
RD.AMT

If the REPAYMENT.METHOD field on the relevant PD.PARAMETER record indicates that repayments are to be made by date order, as opposed to amount type irrespective of date, then the amount allocated to the associated type will be subdivided by date. The associated sub valued fields RD.AMT to RD.TAX.LCY will contain the actual amounts allocated to each due date. This field will contain the repayment amount allocated to each payment date.
No Input field. Part of the sub valued assocation of REPAY.DATE to RD.TAX.LCCY. Standard T24 amount field.

REPAID.STATUS

Signifies the status of the payment which was due on the date in the field PAYMENT.DTE.DUE. This field is automatically populated when the PD contract is created or subsequently updated. The contents of this field may be changed by using the MAINTENANCE operation. The normal order of status changes through the life of a PD contract are that it starts off with a status of either PRE (pre-grace), or GRA (grace period), after which it becomes PDO (past due obligation) and then it finally changes to the status of NAB (non-accrual basis). The number of days that it takes to go through these status changes is dependent on the values defined on the PD.PARAMETER record. The contents of this field may also contain the values RPD (repaid) or WOF (written off). If the WOF option is chosen, all dues under the PD contract will be written off. It should be noted that it is not possible to change the status backwards i.e. if the present status is "PDO", then it is not possible to change it back to "GRA". It is also not possible to change the status to "RPD" as this is only done automatically by the system if the total outstanding amount due is fully repaid. The user may also change the status of the contract to FWOF (financial write-off). Unlike WOF, where only PD dues are written off (i.e there can still be a live underlying contract), FWOF can be used only if the underlying contract has been completely liquidated (ie) the contract is entirely in PD module. Even if the FWOF option is chosen for one set of dues, it results in the entire PD contract being written off. A contract in FWOF status will continue to show the dues frozen as on the date of the FWOF. This field is part of an associated multivalue set.

3 alphabetical characters which may be "PDO", "NAB" or "WOF". (Associated multivalue field). Input only allowed with MAINTENANCE operation. Status may not be changed backwards, e.g. from "NAB" to "PDO". FWOF status cannot be chosen if there is an underlying contract in CUR status. FWOF can be chosen only if REVERSE.PL.AT.NAB = YES and SUSPEND.INCOME =YES in the relevant PD.PARAMETER record Once a contract is in FWOF status, REPAYMENT, ADJUSTMENT and SCHEDULE changes would not be permitted If more than one payment is due, i.e. there is more than one value in the field PAYMENT.DTE.DUE, then the status of the later payment may not be in a more advanced state than the previous payment. For example if the status of the older payment is "PDO", then the status of the later payment could not be changed to "NAB".

Defines the processing to be performed on the PD contract.
Only one type of process may be performed at one time of which there are four. They are MAINTENANCE, ADJUSTMENT, REPAYMENT and SCHEDULE.

Upon input to a PD contract this is the only field which allows any input. Once an operation to be performed has been input this field blocks any further input and opens up the required fields depending upon the operation. Therefore to perform another operation on the same contract, the record must be authorised or deleted, unless of course one exits using F1.

The MAINTENANCE operation is used to change contract details such as the limit reference of the PD contract, the status of individual payments due on a particular date, whether or not to net any entries across the customer's account together, or to change the customer's portfolio.
The ADJUSTMENT operation is used to adjust the outstanding payment amounts, by type, either upwards or downwards.
The REPAYMENT operation is used to for entering details when a customer wishes to repay all or part of his/her loan.

Signifies the status of the payment which was due on the date in the field PAYMENT.DTE.DUE.
This field is automatically populated when the PD contract is created or subsequently updated.
The contents of this field may be changed by using the MAINTENANCE operation.

The normal order of status changes through the life of a PD contract are that it starts off with a status of either PRE (pre-grace), or GRA (grace period), after which it becomes PDO (past due obligation) and then it finally changes to the status of NAB (non-accrual basis).

The number of days that it takes to go through these status changes is dependent on the values defined on the PD.PARAMETER record. The contents of this field may also contain the values RPD (repaid) or WOF (written off). If the WOF option is chosen, all dues under the PD contract will be written off.

It should be noted that it is not possible to change the status backwards i.e. if the present status is "PDO", then it is not possible to change it back to "GRA". It is also not possible to change the status to "RPD" as this is only done automatically by the system if the total outstanding amount due is fully repaid.

The user may also change the status of the contract to FWOF (financial write-off). Unlike WOF, where only PD dues are written off (i.e there can still be a live underlying contract), FWOF can be used only if the underlying contract has been completely liquidated (ie) the contract is entirely in PD module. Even if the FWOF option is chosen for one set of dues, it results in the entire PD contract being written off. A contract in FWOF status will continue to show the dues frozen as on the date of the FWOF.
